item.title: Sony Is Launching a Cheaper, Japanese-Language Only Digital PS5 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
Sony is taking a page out of Nintendo's book with its console variations. Just like how Nintendo released a Japanese-language-only variation of the Nintendo Switch 2, a version of the console that is only sold in Japan and only has Japanese as an available language on the device, Sony is doing the same with a new Japanese-language-only digital PS5 console. Also, just like the Japan-only variant of the Switch 2, it's slightly cheaper than getting the standard version.

You could argue that it was an odd choice by Sony to end its State of Play Japan event with not a new game reveal or announcement, but the reveal of a Japan-only PS5 console, but you can't really act surprised since the whole event was meant for the Japanese consumer. From that angle, it makes perfect sense to try persuading anyone who hasn't bought in on the PS5 yet in Japan with a new, cheaper version they can run out and buy.

Currently, a standard digital PS5 in Japan costs ¬•72,980 ($475), though this new regional variant will drop the price to ¬•55,000 ($355), which is more than a solid discount. But that's still more expensive than what the price of the console when it launched in 2020, which was ¬•39,980 ($260). This new price is actually a bit of a middle ground compared to where the price of the console was at launch, and where it is now after two price increases.

Compared to the rest of the world, players in Japan who have not yet bought a PS5 are going to get the best deal currently available, since $355 USD is significantly cheaper than the price of the console elsewhere in the world.

It'll be interesting to see if Sony brings this same tactic to the PS5 Pro, to extend the reach of its higher-end model.

Follow Wccftech on Google or add us as a preferred source, to get our news coverage and reviews in your feeds.

item.title: LEGO Quietly Offloads Obi-Wan Kenobi‚Äôs Starfighter, Now Selling for Pocket Change on Amazon
item.content:encoded:
LEGO‚Äôs Star Wars line is the brick giant‚Äôs most popualr franchise but the company rarely discounts these sets on its own website. Amazon just changed the game by dropping Obi-Wan Kenobi‚Äôs Jedi Starfighter to an all-time low of $25, down from its regular $29 price tag. This 282-piece set from Attack of the Clones gives you the iconic blue starfighter, three minifigures including a debut character and enough playability to keep young Jedi entertained for hours.

See at Amazon

A Starfighter That Delivers on All Fronts

The build itself captures the sleek design of Obi-Wan‚Äôs Delta-7 Aethersprite-class interceptor impressively well considering the compact size. You get retractable landing gear that actually works, and gives kids the satisfaction of transforming the ship from flight mode to landed position via a simple mechanism. The cockpit opens smoothly to fit the Obi-Wan minifigure, complete with his blue lightsaber that stores in dedicated clips on the exterior when he‚Äôs flying. Two stud shooters mounted on the wings let you recreate those intense space battles from the Geonosis sequence, and fires with enough force to knock over other LEGO creations without being dangerous.

R4-P17, Obi-Wan‚Äôs faithful astromech droid, gets a special attachment point on the wing where you can place the head of the droid. This detail mirrors how the droid integrates directly into the starfighter in the movies and provides navigation and repair capabilities during missions. The Taun We minifigure marks her first appearance in any LEGO set, which matters to collectors who track these releases. She‚Äôs the Kaminoan who greets Obi-Wan at the cloning facility and her inclusion adds a narrative element beyond just the starfighter itself.

The finished model measures 10 inches long, 5 inches wide, and just over 2.5 inches tall, which makes it substantial enough to display on a shelf without taking up half your bookcase. The proportions work well for swooshing around during play sessions, and construction feels solid enough to survive typical handling from seven-year-olds. LEGO designed this set with a balance between structural integrity and the ability to actually play with it rather than creating a fragile display piece that falls apart if you look at it wrong.

At 282 pieces, you‚Äôre looking at roughly an hour or two of building time depending on experience level. The instruction booklet breaks everything down into clear steps with color-coded sections so younger builders won‚Äôt get frustrated trying to figure out which tiny piece goes where. This piece count hits the sweet spot where it‚Äôs engaging enough to feel like an accomplishment but not so overwhelming that kids lose interest halfway through.

The $25 price works out to less than nine cents per piece so this is a pretty comfortable margin below the average LEGO price. Star Wars sets are typically a bit more expensive than average because of the licensing fees, so it‚Äôs not common to find one below the usual retail price.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/lego-quietly-offloads-obi-wan-kenobis-starfighter-now-selling-for-pocket-change-on-amazon-2000643056

item.title: Sony Announces Cheaper PS5 That‚Äôs Only For Japan
item.content:encoded:
During Tuesday‚Äôs Japan-focused State of Play, Sony announced a new, cheaper Japanese-language-only PlayStation 5 Digital Edition console that will be available exclusively in Japan. It‚Äôs likely a reaction to tariffs in the United States, inflation in Japan, and Nintendo‚Äôs own cheaper Japan-only Switch 2.

On November 11, at the very end of PlayStation‚Äôs latest State of Play broadcast, Sony Interactive Entertainment CEO Hideaki Nishino announced ‚Äúsomething very special‚Äù for gamers in Japan: A Japanese-language-only PS5 console that will cost ¬•55,000 yen, which is roughly $350 USD. That same console, following a price increase earlier this year, now costs $500 in the United States. Currently, the digital-only PS5 in Japan costs roughly ¬•73,000. So if you live in Japan and know the language, you can save quite a bit of money buying this cheaper, Japanese-only version of the PS5, which goes on sale on November 21.

As to why Sony is releasing a cheaper, Japan-only PS5, there are a few factors. One of the big ones, as reported by the Financial Times, is rising inflation and the yen losing value in Sony‚Äôs home country. And since, as Dr. Serkan Toto, CEO of Tokyo-based game industry consultancy Kantan Games told VGC, many gamers in Japan don‚Äôt care about their consoles being region-locked or restricted to Japanese only, this is a way for Sony to offer a cheaper console to one of its key markets.

It also makes it harder for resellers and people outside of Japan to snatch up PS5 consoles at a cheaper price, a factor that led to Nintendo offering its very own Japan-only Switch 2 console earlier this year.

And yeah, that‚Äôs another likely reason for a Japan-only PS5: The Switch 2 is doing very well in the country, and the OG Switch is holding its own, too. Sony‚Äôs pricey PS5 is likely too much for consumers in Japan who are struggling with inflation. A cheaper, region-locked PS5 that can‚Äôt be easily resold on the grey market could be a big hit in Japan and help Sony regain some ground. It also marks Sony‚Äôs first region-locked console since the PlayStation 2.

Of course, one more factor in all of this is the ongoing tariffs enacted by President Donald Trump. These tariffs led to Sony raising the price of all PS5 consoles in the United States earlier this year, and a Japan-only PS5 can help the company focus on its local market without having to pay high tariffs or deal with outside buyers. Who had ‚ÄúRegion-Locked Consoles Return In 2025‚Äù on their horrible bingo card?



https://kotaku.com/sony-announces-cheaper-ps5-thats-only-for-japan-2000643085

item.title: Elden Ring: Nightreign Gets Its First DLC Next Month
item.content:encoded:
Elden Ring: Nightreign is getting its first meaty, proper, named DLC next month, including new bosses, new shifting earth, and new playable Nightfarers. The DLC is called The Forsaken Hollows, and it's out on December 4, 2025.

This comes from a trailer shown during today's State of Play, which showed off a lot of clips from what's to come, albeit without a lot of context. There's a clip showing what seems to be a new Shifting Earth known as The Great Hollow, which opens up a huge hole in the middle of Limveld with temples, towers, and crystals sticking out. We see two new Nightfarers: the first is the Undertaker, which uses strength and faith as her primary stats, and the Scholar, which seems to be an arcane-focused magic-user.

There are also two new bosses that should be familiar to FromSoft veterans. Most notable is a glimpse of Artorias, subject of the original Dark Souls DLC Artorias of the Abyss.

A voiceover that sounds a lot like Duchess also refers to "the aftermath of the Long Night," perhaps implying that this DLC takes place after the "end" of Nightreign when the Nightfarers have defeated all the Nightlords. There's also something at the beginning about the "Dreglord". As usual, Souls fans will probably have to wait for the post-release lore videos to make sense of this one. It's unclear how much story content this is really going to add, or if it's just the bosses, the characters, and the shifting earth.

Elden Ring: Nightreign is Bandai Namco's multiplayer riff on Elden Ring, where 1-3 players can fight their way through three nights of exploration, loot hunting, and bosses as they try to take down powerful Night Lords. The game launched back in May, and we gave it a 7/10, saying "When Elden Ring Nightreign is played exactly as it was designed to be played, it‚Äôs one of the finest examples of a three-player co-op game around ‚Äì but that's harder to do than it should be, and playing solo is poorly balanced."

Elden Ring Nightreign Review Screenshots

Since its release, FromSoftware has made a number of balance tweaks, added a duos mode, and updated with an ultra-hard difficulty mode called Deep of Night for those who for some reason didn't think the game was hard enough as-is. However, the last few months have been quiet, and fans have grown agitated at the lack of news or updates, with FromSoftware leaving them to just fight the same bosses over and over. FromSoftware moved to reassure everyone just yesterday in a financial report, and today's DLC announcement should help matters as well. It looks like the DLC will cost $15.00 if you don't already own either the Collectors or Deluxe edition of the game.

You can catch up on everything announced at today's State of Play right here.

Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. You can find her posting on BlueSky @duckvalentine.bsky.social. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com.

In This Article

item.title: FATAL FRAME II: Crimson Butterfly REMAKE launches March 12, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Digital Deluxe Edition and pre-order bonuses detailed.

Horror adventure game remake FATAL FRAME II: Crimson Butterfly REMAKE will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steamon March 12, 2026, publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Team NINJA announced.

In addition to the standard edition, a Digital Deluxe Edition will also be available, which includes the base game, a digital soundtrack, and a digital art book, as well as the ‚ÄúDigital Deluxe Bonus Set‚Äù featuring a Deluxe Charm, Lace Gloves (Black), Lace Gloves (White), Japanese Gothic (Right Wing), and Japanese Gothic (Left Wing).

Early purchases include the ‚ÄúEarly Purchase Bonus Set‚Äù featuring a Wraith Charm, Peony Hair Ornament (Red), Peony Hair Ornament (Blue), Kimono (Black), and Kimono (Red).

Pre-orders include the ‚ÄúPre-Order Bonus Set‚Äù featuring a Spirit Charm, Cat Ears (Black), Cat Ears (White), Crimson Butterfly ‚Äì Mayu (Original), and Crimson Butterfly ‚Äì Mio (Original).

  • ‚ùÆ
  • ‚ùØ

Here is an overview of the game, via Koei Tecmo:

About

The full remake of the second installment in the FATAL FRAME series, originally released in 2003, titled FATAL FRAME II: Crimson Butterfly. This Japanese-style horror adventure game follows twin sisters who become lost in an abandoned village haunted by vengeful spirits. Using the Camera Obscura‚Äîa device that can capture and seal away the impossible‚Äîthey fight ghosts as the story unfolds.

This title has undergone a complete overhaul, with improvements to everything from visuals and audio to the core gameplay systems and controls. The signature Camera Obscura mechanic, used to capture and fend off spirits, remains a key feature, now offering richer and more engaging gameplay in both exploration and combat. In addition, the new ‚ÄúHolding Hands with Mayu‚Äù mechanic adds a heartfelt touch, letting you experience the deep bond between the sisters like never before.

Story

Twin sisters Mio and Mayu Amakura visit a stream they remember from their childhood memories.

The area will soon be submerged by a dam. As Mio reminisces, her older sister Mayu is drawn away by a crimson-colored butterfly, leading her toward the rumored village that no longer appears on any map.

It is a village of vengeful spirits hunting for the twins girls who fled their ritual. A village of never-ending night.

As Mio tries to find Mayu and escape from the village, her actions unknowingly retrace the horrors of the past.

In the deepest reaches of the village, Mio uncovers the truth behind the ‚Äúforbidden ritual that must never be witnessed.‚Äù

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Coffee Talk Tokyo launches March 5, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

The next standalone chapter in the Coffee Talk series.

Coffee Talk Tokyo will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on March 5, 2026, publisher and developer Chorus Worldwide, and developer Toge Productions announced.

A Collector‚Äôs Edition will also be available, which includes a 10-track ‚ÄúCity Pop Album,‚Äù the ‚ÄúSeattle Prologue Chapter,‚Äù and an in-game digital art book.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Set in a late-night cafe in Tokyo, Coffee Talk Tokyo invites players to step into the role of the barista, brewing drinks that warm the hearts of humans and fantastical beings alike. Each cup influences the tone of every conversation, revealing the stories, dreams, and struggles of a completely new cast of characters.

Players can experiment with both hot and cold drinks, enhance their latte art with sprinkle stencils, and explore Tomodachill, an in-game social feed that unlocks hidden insights into their customers‚Äô lives.

The experience is wrapped in a chill lo-fi soundtrack by Andrew ‚ÄúAJ‚Äù Jeremy, returning composer from Coffee Talk and Coffee Talk Episode 2: Hibiscus & Butterfly, blending calm jazz and soft beats inspired by Tokyo‚Äôs summer nights.

Key Features

  • New Cafe, New Stories ‚Äì Meet an all-new cast of characters in a reimagined setting inspired by Tokyo‚Äôs nightscape.
  • Serve and Connect ‚Äì Craft drinks that shape conversations and influence branching storylines.
  • Enhanced Creativity ‚Äì Master new latte art tools, including sprinkle stencils for personalized designs.
  • Tomodachill Social Feed ‚Äì Discover clues and connections that reveal new dialogue options.
  • Lo-Fi Soundtrack by Andrew ‚ÄúAJ‚Äù Jeremy ‚Äì A fresh collection of relaxing tracks capturing the rhythm of city life.
  • Full Localization ‚Äì Available in nine languages: English, Japanese, Brazilian Portuguese, Korean, French, German, Spanish, Simplified Chinese and Traditional Chinese.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

item.title: inKONBINI: One Store. Many Stories. launches in April 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Simulation game centered around a small-town convenience store in the 1990s.

inKONBINI: One Store. Many Stories., a slice-of-life narrative-driven simulation game set in a small-town convenience store in early 1990s Japan, will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC and Mac via Steam in April 2026, publisher Beep Japan and developer Nagai Industries announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

inKONBINI: One Store. Many Stories is a slice-of-life narrative-driven simulation game centered around a small-town convenience store in the early 1990s. Shelve goods, engage in meaningful conversations with your customers, and explore the ways you can impact their lives with your decisions.

Discover joy and wonder hidden behind the daily routine of a konbini worker, engage in meaningful conversations with a diverse cast of characters, and see how their stories intertwine in a beautifully-rendered early 1990s Japan.

inKONBINI: One Store. Many Stories is a meditative third-person single-player experience that puts you in the shoes of Makoto Hayakawa, a college student taking a break from her studies to help her aunt at the small and cozy convenience store.

Over the course of the game, you‚Äôre going to establish your own ways of managing the store and see how your day-to-day decisions affect the lives of your customers.

You will learn their buying habits and develop a unique approach to each one of them in order to make their experience at the store smooth and pleasant.

strong>Key Features

  • A relaxing, narrative-driven experience focused on character stories and dialogue interaction;
  • A diverse cast of characters with their own distinct personalities, buying habits, and little quirks that make each encounter memorable;
  • A variety of accessible mini-games, carefully recreating a store clerk‚Äôs daily routine (restock products, make phone calls, scan goods, and checkout your customers);
  • An authentic, beautifully-rendered konbini with a nostalgic feel of the early 1990s;
  • A branching storyline with multiple dialogue options, offering deep conversational experience;
  • An ASMR sound designed to compliment your playtime with sensations of calm and solace.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Window Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/inkonbini-one-store-many-stories-launches-in-april-2026

item.title: Get A Rare Discount On Lego's 768-Piece Horizon Adventures Battle Set
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Lego Horizon Adventures building set has received a rare discount at Amazon and Walmart. Normally $45, the 768-piece playset is discounted to $38.24 for a limited time. Based on last year's Lego Horizon Adventures video game, this building set features minifigure versions of Aloy and Varl battling Lego models of Sawtooth and Shell-Walker Machines.

Lego Horizon Adventures: Aloy & Varl vs. Shell-Walker & Sawtooth

$38.24 (was $45) | 768 Pieces

Aloy & Varl vs. Shell-Walker & Sawtooth released March 1 and has largely maintained its original $45 price. Considering it comes with 768 pieces, the Horizon Adventures set was already a bargain at full price compared to many licensed Lego sets.

The buildable Machines are larger than you might expect, too. Sawtooth, for example, is 7 x 4.5 x 3 inches. Both Machines have numerous points of articulation to create different poses or to play with them like action figures. You can turn Sawtooth's neck, head, legs, and hips as well as open his jaws on both sides. Meanwhile, the Shell-Walker Machine has adjustable legs and claws. Shell-Walker also has detachable cargo pod and shield accessories.

Aloy wields her signature bow, while Varl has his spear. Each weapon can be modded with accessories representing elemental attacks--fire, chill, and shock--from the game. The playset also includes two small baseplates with miniature builds of tall reeds, a treasure chest, and a campfire.

Aloy & Varl vs. Shell-Walker & Sawtooth isn't the first Lego set based on PlayStation's Horizon franchise. In 2022, Lego designed an awesome 1,222-piece Tallneck based on the Machine's appearance in Horizon Forbidden West.

Unfortunately, the Tallneck was discontinued by Lego at the end of 2023. It was still possible to find the Tallneck at Amazon last year, but the retailer sold out over the holidays due to a Black Friday discount. Reseller prices have risen throughout 2025; sellers on Amazon's marketplace are currently asking $160 for the Tallneck. At face value, this price may sound too outlandish for a large Lego model designed for adults, but the Tallneck originally retailed for $90. Despite the inflated cost, Amazon's store page notes 100-plus units sold over the last 30 days.

If you haven't played the Lego Horizon Adventures video game, physical editions for PS5 and Nintendo Switch are available for low prices at multiple retailers.

  • Lego Horizon Adventures for PS5
    • Woot -- $22 ($40)
    • Amazon -- $31.49 ($40)
  • Lego Horizon Adventures for Switch
    • Amazon -- $26.86 ($40)
    • Walmart -- $26.87 ($40)

Horizon Forbidden West: 10-Inch Aloy Plush

$6 (was $20)

The PlayStation Shapes Collection also includes a 10-inch Aloy plush. The plush debuted with a $20 price, but Amazon is selling it for only $6 right now. Aloy's hunter garb has embroidered details, red braids, and other small details that match her appearance in Horizon Forbidden West.

Aloy is one of two plushies in the PlayStation Shapes lineup. The other option is God of War's main character Kratos. The plushie version of Kratos has a textured beard, which is pretty cool, but it's not as cheap as the Aloy edition right now. God of War fans can get the Kratos plush for $16.

item.title: Sony is releasing a PlayStation Gaming Monitor, but it's only available in the US and Japan
item.content:encoded:
27 inches on your desktop.

Sony revealed its latest piece of hardware at tonight's State of Play event: a 27" Gaming Monitor that's coming only to the US and Japan.

The company is expanding its hardware offering even further, following its PlayStation Portal remote player with a desktop gaming monitor, complete with charging hook for your PS5 controller. It'll also pair with the Pulse Elevate wireless speakers.

The monitor will be released next year, though there's no date or price just yet. It's also unclear why it's only coming to the US and Japan.

The specifications for the monitor, as shared on the PlayStation Blog, are as follows:

  • A Quad High Definition (QHD) IPS display up to 2560 x 1440 resolution,* so players can game at a comfortable viewing distance from their desk.
  • High Dynamic Range support with Auto HDR Tone Mapping that automatically adjusts HDR settings during setup on PS5 and PS5 Pro consoles, ensuring rich and vivid picture quality.*
  • VRR support and refresh rates of up to 120 Hz for smooth and seamless gameplay on PS5 and PS5 Pro consoles, and 240 Hz on compatible PC and Mac devices.
  • A built-in Charging Hook for a DualSense or DualSense Edge wireless controller (sold separately) that makes it easy for players to get right into gaming.

It also has the following ports:

  • Two HDMI IN port (ver 2.1) and one DisplayPort IN port (ver 1.4)** for compatibility with PS5, PC, Mac, or other devices
  • HDMI IN port (ver 2.1) supports up to 2560√ó1440, 240Hz, FRL, VRR; DisplayPort IN port (ver 1.4) supports up to 2560√ó1440, 240Hz, DSC
  • Two USB Type-A and one USB Type-C port that can be used with PlayStation Link Adapters or other devices
  • Built-in stereo speaker and 3.5mm audio output
  • Compatibility with select VESA mounting systems for a more flexible display setup

The reveal of the monitor means the PS5 console will be playable in multiple ways, be it on your TV, via handheld, or at your desk.

Indeed, while some may have been sceptical of the Portal, it's proven surprisingly popular and can now stream PS5 games directly.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/sony-is-releasing-a-playstation-gaming-monitor-but-its-only-available-in-the-us-and-japan

item.title: But What If The Babies WANT To Worship Extra Deities?
item.content:encoded:
'Stopped babies born in fort' from doing what

Published: November 11, 2025, 6:42 pm

The fact Dwarf Fortress has some incredible patch notes is not a new thing, but even by this game's lofty standards, the latest round of fixes is some wild shit.

As part of the game's Siege Update, earlier this week some minor patches were also applied, and they include the following:

Fixed crash when loading certain historical figures from the disk.
Fixed an occasional crash when doing multi-stage construction.
Fixed issue where battering ram operators could get stuck in ground when the ram turns.
Stopped brewing jobs from searching for improper items.

All fine. Normal patch stuff. The final one, though, is:

Stopped babies born in fort from worshipping extra deities.

I have so many questions. Why are they born worshipping any deities at all, let alone extra ones? How have they become aware of them, intravenously? If that's normal, why is worshipping one OK, but not others?

I need answers. Or...do I? Maybe I should just stop asking questions. Maybe I should just accept that this is the universe the game has made for itself and marvel at the beauty of it:



https://aftermath.site/but-what-if-the-babies-want-to-worship-extra-deities/

item.title: Arc System Works Shows New Look at Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls, Closed Beta Coming in December
item.content:encoded:
Arc System Works was one of the studios we predicted would appear at the State of Play Japan, specifically with a release date for Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls. Well, we were right that we'd get to see Arc System Works and with more Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls, but we did not get a release date revealed, and are still saddled with an expected release window of '2026.' That said, there is a new closed beta lined up before the end of the year.

Arc System Works also showed off more gameplay for Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls, and two of the game's developers also made an appearance during the live stream to talk more about the game, and how the studio wanted to blend Japanese art styles with the style of the comic books.

The new closed beta will run from December 5-7, and adds Spider-Man and Ghost Rider to the roster of playable characters to try out in the beta. It'll also include two new stages, and a bevy of fixes and tweaks based on feedback from the game's first closed beta earlier this year.

If you registered for the first closed beta and participated, then you'll be automatically registered for this one. If you registered for the first one and didn't participate, then you should keep an eye on your email inbox for an invitation. If you didn't register for the first closed beta but want to try your luck this time, then you can register at this link.

Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls is due to launch on PC and PS5 sometime in 2026.

Follow Wccftech on Google or add us as a preferred source, to get our news coverage and reviews in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/arc-system-works-shows-more-marvel-tokon-fighting-souls-closed-beta-december/

item.title: Pixel 9 Now Priced Like Budget Android Phones, Amazon Strikes Hard at Google
item.content:encoded:
Amazon just delivered a serious blow to Google by chopping the Pixel 9 128GB down to an all-time low of $544 on its own platform. This unlocked smartphone is normally $799, but you can currently get it for 32% off which places Google‚Äôs flagship in the same price bracket as mid-tier Android devices. The irony isn‚Äôt lost here: Amazon is making Google‚Äôs premium phone more affordable than Google ever has.

See at Amazon

Google‚Äôs Flagship Gets the Budget Phone Treatment

The Pixel 9 is equipped with a large 6.3-inch Actua display for sharp visuals-be it when scrolling through social media or watching videos on a commute. This screen size comes as a sweet spot: big enough for comfortable viewing and compact enough to be managed by one hand when you juggle coffee and groceries. Display technology ensures colors pop without the oversaturated look that some phones push just a bit too hard and gives you an accurate representation whether editing photos or simply browsing.

Under the hood, you get 128GB of storage (which works out to about 30,000 photos) or several dozen apps, before you have to start thinking about cloud backup. In many ways, the 24-hour battery life lets you leave your charger at home without anxiety for a full workday and into an evening out. Google achieved this by combining power management on its processors with display optimization that adapts to whatever you‚Äôre doing, whether that‚Äôs reading email or streaming content.

Where the Pixel 9 really earns its keep is in the camera system: The heavy lifting is done through Google‚Äôs computational photography which means the phone is processing multiple exposures in milliseconds to create shots that look professionally edited straight out of the camera app. Night photography becomes actually useable rather than a grainy mess, thanks to algorithms that brighten shadows while keeping highlights in check.

Integration with Gemini places Google‚Äôs AI assistant right into the core of your workflow: You can ask it to summarize long email threads, draft responses with a specific tone, or pull information from your photos and documents without having to jump between apps. This is not just a repackaged voice assistant; it understands context from your screen and can help with tasks like planning trips by scanning flight confirmations and suggesting activities based on your destination.

What‚Äôs great is that unlocked means you are not tied to any carrier‚Äôs payment plan or restrictions. You can switch providers without dealing with unlock requests or compatibility issues, and international travel is easier, as you can just pop in a local SIM card. This flexibility alone can save you hundreds over a two-year period compared to locked alternatives that charge premium rates for roaming.

Right now, you‚Äôre paying just $565 for flagship specs and Google‚Äôs best camera tech; that‚Äôs less than what many mid-range phones sell for.

item.title: Everything We Saw At PlayStation‚Äôs Japan-Centric State Of Play
item.content:encoded:
Today, Sony held a State of Play showcase to talk about upcoming PlayStation 5 games, but this one was a little different. This one was specifically focused on Japan-developed games, as well as projects from other Asian studios. The State of Play Japan showcase was hosted by Ys actor Yuki Kaji, and was only streamed in Japanese, even in other territories. It did have English subtitles, though, so if you want to watch the 40-minute presentation, you can do so below. If you just want the highlights, though, we‚Äôve got you covered.

Dragon Quest VII Reimagining

Kicking off the show was Dragon Quest VII Remastered. I don‚Äôt know why I was surprised that the trailer was in English. I guess I just assumed the ‚ÄúJapanese audio with English subtitles‚Äù extended to the trailers as well. But anyway, we saw a pretty story-heavy trailer of this from-the-ground-up reimagining of Dragon Quest VII. The game is coming out on February 5.

inKONBINI: One Store, Many Stories

Next up is a management sim called inKONBINI: One Store, Many Stories, in which the player runs a corner store. You‚Äôll manage your merchandise, chat with customers, and collect stuff from the vending machines in April 2026.

Coffee Talk Tokyo

The next entry in the coffee shop social simulator series Coffee Talk is Coffee Talk Tokyo, which is exactly what it sounds like. You‚Äôll make coffee for patrons in a cyberpunk Tokyo on March 5.

BrokenLore

Two new games in the BrokenLore horror series are coming. The first is Unfollow, which is all about the dark side of social media. It‚Äôs coming on January 16. The next entry will be called BrokenLore: Ascend, and will have a focus on vertical climbing movement. It will launch next summer.

Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly

Sony decided to get a bunch of spooky stuff out of the way at once, as next up is a remake of Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly helmed by Dead or Alive and Ninja Gaiden developer Team Ninja. Yeah, that shit looks as creepy as it did on the PS2. The remake will launch on March 12.

Dynasty Warriors: Origins

Koei Tecmo also showed off a new DLC for Dynasty Warriors: Origins called Visions of Four Heroes. It launches on January 22.

Gran Turismo 7

Oh hey, at least one of the teams under PlayStation Studios is here for the show. Polyphony Digital showed up with the Gran Turismo 7 Power Pack, which will add new racing modes to the game later this year.

Rapid-fire announcements

Next up we saw a few smaller games like MotionRec, a sci-fi puzzle platformer, Wandering Sword, an HD-2D RPG set in ancient China, the PS4 and PS5 release of No Sleep For Kadame Date ‚Äì AI The Somnium Files, and Tokyo Xtreme Racer. 

Bandai Namco‚Äôs DLC minute

Bandai Namco had a few DLCs to announce for some of its games. First up was Once Upon a Katamari, which is getting two DLC packs with new levels, cosmetics, and music. Pac-Man World 2: Re-Pac is getting Sonic the Hedgehog levels, which are available today. Digimon Story: Time Stranger‚Äòs first DLC includes a new story chapter that adds five new Digimon to the roster, and is coming this winter. Super Robot Wars Y is getting its first collab DLC, which adds characters from Kamen Rider.

Monster Hunter Wilds

Monster Hunter Wilds is also getting some DLC. The Free Title Update 4 will launch on December 16, and adds more monsters to hunt and additions to the RPG‚Äôs endgame.

Sonic Racing: Crossworlds

Because the crossover slop never ends, Sonic Racing: Crossworlds is getting more crossover characters as DLC from Nights and Super Monkey Ball. It‚Äôll also get Tangle and Whisper, some lesser-known Sonic characters. Oh yeah, and the Spongebob pack is coming on November 19. Blah.

Never Grave: The Witch and the Curse

Next up is Never Grave: The Witch and the Curse, an action platformer that looks like the kind of thing you‚Äôd play if Hollow Knight: Silksong just wasn‚Äôt enough torment for you. The game will launch on March 5.

Blazblue: Entropy Effect X

I see Arc System Works‚Äô logo and I perk up. The studio is making a new entry in the Blazblue: Entropy Effect subseries with Entropy Effect X. The action platformer has the team‚Äôs incredible visual flare and looks super challenging. It will launch on February 12.

More rapid fire game updates

Nextt we got another series of bite-sized looks at some smaller games. First up is twin-stick shooter/platformer Damon and Baby, followed by a new Prinny-infested action RPG from the Disgaea team called Kyouran Makaism. Fate Trigger, a fast-paced hero shooter featuring ten distinct playable characters, wrapped up the segment.

Octopath Traveler 0

Damn. The host mentioned a beloved Square Enix series and my Kingdom Hearts copium started up. But no, instead we got a new look at Octopath Traveler 0. It sure looks like one of those! Square Enix has released a demo that will allow you to carry over your saved data to the main game when it launches on December 4.

Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls

Now that‚Äôs the Arc System Works game I wanted to see. The studio‚Äôs upcoming Marvel game is putting an anime fighter spin on the comic book icons. Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls is getting a new beta test that will include new stages and add Spider-Man and Ghost Rider as playable characters. The test will take place from December 5 to 7.

Elden Ring Nightreign

Bandai Namco wasn‚Äôt done with DLC, actually. Elden Ring Nightreign got its own special little segment for its The Forsaken Hollows expansion. If you and your friends are ready to head back into The Lands Between, you can do so December 4.

Oh, that was the end? Alrighty then. RIP to the Kingdom Hearts fans who were holding their breath. We‚Äôll do this whole song and dance again at The Game Awards.



https://kotaku.com/playstation-state-of-play-japan-marvel-dragon-quest-2000643049

item.title: PS5 Digital Edition Japan-only model announced
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Due out on November 21 for 55,000 yen.

Sony Interactive Entertainment Japan Asia has announced a Japanese-language-only SKU for PlayStation 5 Digital Edition. It will launch on November 21 for 55,000 (tax included), with pre-orders opening on November 13.

The existing all-languages SKU for PlayStation 5 in Japan is currently priced at 72,980 yen, meaning the Japanese-language SKU is 17,980 yen cheaper, and only 5,020 yen more expensive than the Japanese-language SKU for Switch 2.

The Japanese-language PlayStation 5 can only be used with PlayStation Network accounts registered in Japan, and the system language can only be set to Japanese.

item.title: DAMON and BABY launches in early 2026 for PS5, PS4, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

New action adventure game from Arc System Works gets a release window.

Action adventure game DAMON and BABY will launch for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam in early 2026, developer Arc System Works announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Arc System Works:

About

An unlikely pair, an unforgettable journey.

An exciting new style of action adventure fusing shooting action with exploration.

A New Take on Shooting Action and In-Depth Exploration

Experience a new type of action advent, featuring a fusion between exploration within an expansive world and highly technical twin-stick shooting. At your home base, power up the demon king Damon and make purchases. During the exploration phase, defeat enemies to complete each area. The story progresses as you alternate between the two phases.

  • ‚ùÆ
  • ‚ùØ

Strategic Battles With a Vast Arsenal of Weapons and Gimmicks

The battle mechanics include both close-ranged attacks with handguns as well as long-ranged attacks with machine guns and more.

You can find more powerful weapons as you explore.

During the boss battles awaiting within each stage, a strategic approach making use of the area gimmicks will prove crucial.

Customization and Outfit Changes

Damon grows throughout the adventure, learning to master various weapons and skills. You can customize your set of skills to match your play style. You can even choose from a variety of outfit options to change Damon‚Äôs appearance.

Journey Together with Two-Player Cooperative Play

Take control of Damon‚Äôs canine companion to help him in combat in various ways, such as collecting items.

item.title: No Sleep For Kaname Date ‚Äì From AI: The Somnium Files coming to PS5, Xbox Series, and PS4 on February 26, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

PlayStation 5 version available both physically and digitally.

Spike Chunsoft will release No Sleep For Kaname Date ‚Äì From AI: The Somnium Files for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PlayStation 4 on February 26, 2026 for $39.99, the company announced.

A physical edition will be available for PlayStation 5 in $39.99 standard and $64.99 ‚ÄúTote Bag Bundle‚Äù editions, while the Xbox Series and PlayStation 4 versions will be digital-only.

No Sleep For Kaname Date ‚Äì From AI: The Somnium Files first launched for Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam on July 25.

Here is an overview of the game, via Spike Chunsoft:

About

The player takes on the role of Kaname Date, the protagonist, and once again teams up with the AI-Ball, Aiba, to tackle a mysterious case and rescue Iris, an internet idol who has been forced to take part in a dangerous escape game. No Sleep For Kaname Date ‚Äì From AI: The Somnium Files introduces a new gameplay element: ‚ÄúEscape.‚Äù As with previous games, in ‚ÄúInvestigation,‚Äù players will examine crime scenes and listen to testimonies. In ‚ÄúSomnium,‚Äù players enter the dream worlds of suspects and key witnesses. In the new ‚ÄúEscape‚Äù sections, players will solve puzzles to break out of locked rooms. By moving between these three sections, players can obtain the necessary clues to solve the case.

Story Summary

After The New Cyclops Serial Killings was resolved, internet idol Iris Sagan (known as ‚ÄúA-set‚Äù) is abducted by a UFO and forced to participate in a perilous escape game called The Third Eye Game. Meanwhile, in another part of the city, a mysterious device is discovered. It resembles a coffin, and attached to it is a note that reads:

‚ÄúPsync me.‚Äù

Relying on a tenuous line of communication with the missing Iris, one man rises once again, determined to track down the UFO that should not even exist. Together with his partner, the AI-Ball Aiba, he sets out on a quest. That man‚Ä¶is Special Agent Kaname Date

item.title: Marvel T≈çkon: Fighting Souls Adds X-Mansion Stage, Another Closed Beta In Early December
item.content:encoded:
Marvel T≈çkon: Fighting Souls, a tag-team fighter from the studio behind such hits as Dragon Ball FighterZ and Guilty Gear Strive, is getting another closed beta. The first ran from September 5 to 7, and featured online play, limited offline functionality, and six playable fighters. This new closed beta, which runs from December 5 to 7, adds Spider-Man and Ghost Rider (Robbie Reyes) into the mix as playable characters and adds various other features to give players a better chance to test out the upcoming fighter.

This second closed beta adds Savage Land, which was revealed at Tokyo Game Show, and the X-Mansion, which was revealed today. These two iconic locales come primarily from the X-Men side of the Marvel Universe, and the X-Mansion features Colossus, Beast, Professor X, and other mutants lingering the background. The new beta will also include more consistent online play with no breaks in the gameplay schedule, rollback netcode, expanded offline features, and spectator mode.

With the inclusion of these two new characters into this next closed beta, that brings the full roster for December's closed beta to eight characters: Captain America, Doctor Doom, Ghost Rider, Iron Man, Ms. Marvel, Spider-Man, Star-Lord, and Storm. We do not know how many playable characters will be available in the final game, but if we look at Dragon Ball FighterZ, it included 23 playable characters at launch (including unlockables), plus another 22 post-launch, bringing the total to 45. Marvel has no shortage of well-known characters, so it stands to reason we have quite a few more to learn about in the lead up to launch and after.

Marvel T≈çkon: Fighting Souls arrives on PlayStation 5 and PC at some point in 2026. If you're a subscriber to Game Informer and want more information on this promising fighter, read our exclusive preview feature where we interviewed the team here.



https://gameinformer.com/state-of-play/2025/11/11/marvel-tokon-fighting-souls-adds-x-mansion-stage-another-closed-beta-in

item.title: Pocketpair published Never Grave: The Witch and The Curse gets a release date at last, launching on PlayStation early next year
item.content:encoded:
Never Grave: The Witch and The Curse has finally got a release date. Announced during tonight's State of Play event, the side scrolling action game will be coming out on the 5th March, 2026 on the PS5 and PS4.

Developed by Frontside 180 and published as part of Pocketpair's relatively new video game publishing arm, the game received a new gameplay trailer as part of the announcement.

This trailer not only shows off a few new boss fights, but also an equipment screen, what appears to be a skill tree, and some fancy magically-charged combat. You can watch it yourself below.

Frontside 180, a fully-owned subsidiary of Pocketpair, dropped a Steam demo for Never Grave in January 2024. Since then, it's been cooking away in the background. It's the second game to come from Pocketpair's publishing arm, which Pocketpair staff have said will not work with games using AI, NFTs, or Web 3.

The first game to come from Pocketpair Publishing was Dead Take, which is a fantastic indie project starring popular voice actors Ben Starr, Neil Newbon, and others.

Never Grave: The Witch and The Curse certainly looks charming. Here's hoping Frontside 180 can magic away the months so March comes all the quicker.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/never-grave-the-witch-and-the-curse-gets-a-release-date-at-last-is-coming-to-playstation-early-next-year

item.title: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds is getting another three free characters, and yes one of them is NiGHTS
item.content:encoded:
Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds is set to receive three new free Sega characters over the next few months.

The first, coming next month, is NiGHTS from the iconic Sega Saturn game. Though not officially announced by Sega previously, the character is present on the back of the physical version of the game, so their inclusion has been known since before the game's release. Still, at least we know they're coming in December.

NiGHTS will be followed by Super Monkey Ball's AiAi, the cute little banana-grabbing monkey who's been let out of their ball. AiAi will join in January 2026.

Last up is Tangle and Whisper, dual characters from the Sonic the Hedgehog spin-off comic series that debuted in 2019. Tangle is a lemur and Whisper is a wolf.

These three will join Persona 5's Joker and Like A Dragon's Ichiban, who were both recently added to the game as free additions.

Shortly after the game's release, the paid Minecraft DLC was released, featuring new characters and a new track. Capcom's Mega Man will also join next year.

item.title: Marvel T≈çkon: Fighting Souls Closed Beta 2 announced for December
item.content:encoded:
A second closed beta for Marvel T≈çkon: Fighting Souls has been announced and it launches December 5, 2025 at midnight Pacific Time. It will run until December 7 at 11:59 PM. On the 5th and 6th of December you will be able to battle both online and with CPU opponents, with this being reduced to online only on the 7th of  December.

You should be able to sign up for the closed beta here.

The six playable characters from the first beta, Iron Man, Doctor Doom, Ms Marvel, Storm, Captain America and Star-Lord, will be joined by Spider-Man and Ghost Rider. Two new stages, Savage Land and the X-Mansion have been added to the beta. You will also be able to use the communal space and spectate games.

‚ÄúBased on feedback received from the previous closed beta, we‚Äôve implemented numerous improvements, including balance adjustments, performance optimizations, visual enhancements, and user experience upgrades. More details will be shared as we get closer to the beta test,‚Äù explains Kazuto Sekine, Game Director and Lead Battle Designer.

Marvel T≈çkon: Fighting Soulsis a tag fighter but it is pushing the boundary to be a 4v4 system. There are different ways to approach it. You can use one fighter with the other three in the team being assists, or swap through each character to work out the different styles that they have.

The game is a big collaboration between Sony, Marvel and Arc System Works, who have developed some of the most celebrated fighting games of the past decade including Dragon Ball FighterZ and Guilty Gear Strive.

Looking back at Dragon Ball FighterZ, in our glowing review, Dave wrote, ‚ÄúBy shattering some boundaries, Dragon Ball FighterZ has combat that‚Äôs more than worth getting into, but also a diverse roster and some phenomenal presentation. The Story Mode could have been improved if it were more streamlined, but it‚Äôs a mere blemish on an otherwise spectacular game.‚Äù

Source: PS Blog



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/11/marvel-tokon-fighting-souls-closed-beta-2-announced-for-december/

item.title: Elden Ring: Nightreign: The Forsaken Hollows DLC is coming out in less than a month
item.content:encoded:
Bandai Namco and FromSoftware have revealed a DLC expansion for Elden Ring: Nightreign,and it‚Äôs coming out soon. Really soon. Elden Ring: Nightreign: The Forsaken Hollows will launch on 4th December 2025. That‚Äôs less than a month away!

The Forsaken Hollows will bring additional Nightfarers, Bosses and more into the multiplayer spin-off to one of FromSoftware‚Äôs most beloved games.

The update will introduce the Scholar and the Undertaker as two new playable Nightfarers. They‚Äôre described as follows:

  • Scholar ‚Äì An academic who walks the Lands Between. Boasting impressive arcane levels, he gains incredible advantages through battlefield observation.
  • Undertaker ‚Äì An abbess who was mandated to slay the Nightlord. Boasting impressive strength and faith, she sends enemies to the afterlife with ruthless efficiency.

Two new bosses will also feature in this DLC expansion, and there will be the new area of The Great Hollow, which adds a cavity to explore under Limveld. This includes exotic ruins and temples, sacred towers from forgotten peoples, and crystals and have a life-draining miasma that you‚Äôll probably want to avoid.

Those that pre-order the DLC will receive a digital artbook and mini soundtrack as downloadable apps, though these were previously available as part of the Deluxe Edition and Deluxe Upgrade Pack. In fact, The Forsaken Hollows DLC is included for those who bought the Collectors Edition or Deluxe Edition of Nightreign.

While good, Elden Ring Nightreign didn‚Äôt gather quite the same level of acclaim of its predecessor and currently sits on a score of 77 on Metacritic, though that didn‚Äôt stop millions of eager FromSoftware fans diving in as soon as possible. We gave the game a solid 7/10 in our review, with Jason saying, ‚ÄúElden Ring Nightreign is a fun multiplayer offshoot, but it also doesn‚Äôt come close to the dizzying heights we‚Äôre used to seeing from FromSoftware. It‚Äôs an interesting experiment, and I am glad it exists despite my mixed feelings, but it‚Äôs a shallow happiness when I expect far more profound experiences from this company.‚Äù



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/11/elden-ring-nightreign-the-forsaken-hollows-dlc-is-coming-out-in-less-than-a-month/

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign DLC, The Forsaken Hollows Arrives This December
item.content:encoded:
Just as the community was bemoaning the lack of post-launch support, Elden Ring Nightreign developer FromSoftware and publisher Bandai Namco announced at the State of Play Japan that new DLC is coming to Elden Ring Nightreign, and it'll arrive before the end of the year. The new expansion, The Forsaken Hollows, will arrive on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S this coming December 4, 2025.

This paid DLC expansion adds a few new features to the game, with two new playable Nightfarers to players to try out, two new bosses that FromSoftware is currently being quite tight-lipped about, and what sounds like a new area to explore within Limveld.

The two new Nightfarers are called the Scholar and the Undertaker. The Scholar is described as "boasting impressive arcane levels," and gains "incredible advantages through battlefield observation," while the Undertaker features "impressive strength and faith."

It's not exactly an in-depth description of either character's kit, but it's seemingly all we get for now. We'll definitely learn more the closer we get to the DLC's launch.

As far as the new bosses, all FromSoftware marketing representative Miku Watanabe has to say in the PlayStation Blog post is: "Players will confront two new bosses tormenting Limveld." So, it seems like the new bosses also go in the category of, 'things we'll learn about later.'

Lastly, the DLC also adds The Great Hollow, a hole that has opened up in Limveld that players will get to explore in the new DLC, described as a place that is "strewn with exotic ruins and temples; sacred towers denoting the remains of an ancient people; and crystals that exude a cursed, life-draining miasma."

The DLC will be available for $15 USD, though if you purchased the Deluxe Edition of Nightreign, then you'll just get the DLC added to your library when it arrives on December 4, 2025. Hopefully, we won't have to wait too long to learn more about the DLC.

Follow Wccftech on Google or add us as a preferred source, to get our news coverage and reviews in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/elden-ring-nightreign-dlc-the-forsaken-hollows-release-date/

item.title: Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls Announces Second Closed Beta
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls got a new trailer during today‚Äôs State of Play Japan. In it, the second closed beta was announced, alongside who‚Äôll be included.

Revealed in June, the fighter from ARC System Works, creators of Guilty Gear, teams up with the superheroes of Marvel. Many have already gotten their hands on it with the closed beta and at EVO. Given ARC System Works‚Äô track record, it‚Äôs safe to say it‚Äôll be one to watch. Now, thanks to today‚Äôs State of Play, we have a bit more information on when the next chance to play will be.

Second Closed Beta for Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls Coming December 5th-7th, 2025

The trailer, seen above, we get a look at some new gameplay of Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls. We see new stages, including the X-Mansion with some familiar faces. Most importantly, we see a new closed beta announced for PlayStation 5. The beta will occur from December 5th through December 7th and run all 72-hours. New characters not in the first beta include Spider-Man and Ghost Rider.

Via the PlayStation Blog, the beta will be open to all who participated in the first one. Furthermore, those who expressed interest but didn‚Äôt get in will now be considered for this one. As for the schedule, on December 5 and 6, CPU battles and online matches will be available, with December 7 being only online battles.

The roster, for Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls includes Iron Man, Captain America, Ms. Marvel, Spider-Man, Star-Lord, Storm, Ghost Rider, and Doctor Doom. More characters are expected to join before the game‚Äôs 2026 release. There are a ton of heroes to choose from, so the possibilities are somewhat infinite. Still, it‚Äôll be exciting to see how ARC System Works approaches these characters and how they may differ from other Marvel fighting titles.

Are you excited to play Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls? Who do you want to see added? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

item.title: BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X announced for PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Due out on February 12, 2026.

Publisher Astrolabe Games and developer 91Act will release side-scrolling roguelike action game BlazBlue: Entropy Effect for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch on February 12, 2026 as BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X, the companies announced. Physical editions will be available for PlayStation 5 and Switch, day and date with the digital release. Physical and digital pre-orders are available now.

BlazBlue: Entropy Effect first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on August 15, 2023, followed by a full release on January 31, 2024, followed by iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play on July 22, 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via Astrolabe Games:

About

BlazBlue Entropy Effect X is a roguelite action game set in the BlazBlue universe, featuring striking 2D visuals, stylish, fast-paced combat, and precise, responsive controls.

Command a line-up of unique characters from the renowned BlazBlue franchise and dive into an unparalleled action experience.

Story

At a mysterious domain, known as ‚Äúthe Lab,‚Äù a group of elite researchers race to save a collapsing word; however, despite their efforts to date, Dr. Mercurius, head of the laboratory, still warns the world‚Äôs downfall is near.

In a last-ditch effort, the urgent Research of Possibility initiative seeks to collect Shards of Possibility ‚Äì a special fragment of the world that could forestall the seemingly inevitable destruction. These shards lie within the Sea of Possibility, a realm between worlds, beyond the bounds of reality. The protagonist, Ace, is the only being capable of diving into this sea. Guided by the elite researchers at the Lab, Ace descends again and again in pursuit of salvation‚Äîuntil strange visions take hold and his body begins to change.

As Ace continues to dive, countless memories flood his mind, and the truth behind the collapsing world ‚Äì and the research itself‚Äîbegins to surface‚Ä¶.

‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Ä¶The Power of Azure.‚Äù

  • ‚ùÆ
  • ‚ùØ

Specifications

  • Name: BlazBlue Entropy Effect X
  • Developer: 91Act

item.title: BrokenLore: ASCEND announced for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Tower-climbing survival horror.

Serafini Productions has announced tower-climbing survival horror game BrokenLore: ASCEND for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC (Steam). It will launch in summer 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via Serafini Productions:

BrokenLore: ASCEND is a first-person psychological horror game about obsession, fame, and fear. Join Ren and Yui, two renowned rooftop climbers, as they attempt a forbidden nighttime ascent of Japan‚Äôs tallest building, the mysterious Elysium Tower.

What begins as the ultimate stunt for their channel, SKYLIMIT, soon spirals into a nightmare. A supernatural entity, the Rokurokubi, emerges to haunt them, a twisted reflection of their deepest terror: becoming forgotten and irrelevant.

The higher they climb, the more reality unravels. For Ren and Yui, stopping means losing everything, but reaching the top might cost them their sanity or their lives.

item.title: BrokenLore: UNFOLLOW launches January 16, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Deluxe edition includes exclusive additional ending.

Survival horror game BrokenLore: UNFOLLOW will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on January 16, 2026, publisher Shochiku and developer Serafini Productions announced.

The game will be available in $19.99 standard and $24.99 Deluxe editions. The Deluxe edition includes the original soundtrack, a customizable pet, an exclusive additional ending, and 24 hours of advanced access (PlayStation 5 only).

Here is an overview of the game, via Serafini Productions:

About

BrokenLore: UNFOLLOW is a surreal first-person horror game that will push you to the edge of your seat. You play as Anne, a victim of bullying, trapped in a nightmarish world where you must escape from terrifying monsters while uncovering a dark mystery.

Anne must come to terms with her past‚Äôs most painful choices. However, she‚Äôs not alone. Many horrible creatures wander around and follow her every step‚Ä¶ Will Anne be able to get out?

BrokenLore: UNFOLLOW delves deep into pressing social issues, shining a spotlight on the insidious influence of social media.

Its themes are profound, exploring the intricacies of mental health, body dysmorphia, and the horrors of bullying.

The cast features The Sphere Hunter, Akidearest, Elsie Lovelock, Sharla in Japan, Knite, Kin Ryan, and more!

Key Features

  • Multiple endings will be influenced by the various choices made throughout the game.
  • Distinctive, eerie creatures will each symbolize a different trauma experienced by Anne.
  • Emphasis will be placed on Anne‚Äôs smartphone, which will feature numerous functions.

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Is Getting The Forsaken Hollows DLC In December
item.content:encoded:
Today, during Sony's Japanese-focused State of Play presentation, From Software announced The Forsaken Hollows DLC coming to Elden Ring Nightreign on December 4.

The DLC will add two new playable characters, the Scholar and the Undertaker. The former is an arcane focused player and the latter is more focused on strength and faith.

From Software was not ready to offer additional details about the DLC, which you can read on the PlayStation Blog, simply writing, "Players will confront two new bosses tormenting Limveld."

The PlayStation Blog also makes reference to The Great Hollow, "A great cavity in the depths of Limveld."

To read our Game Informer's Elden Ring Nightreign review, follow the link.



https://gameinformer.com/state-of-play/2025/11/11/elden-ring-nightreign-is-getting-the-forsaken-hollows-dlc-in-december

item.title: Elden Ring: Nightreign's The Forsaken Hollows DLC will see an iconic Dark Souls boss return
item.content:encoded:
Elden Ring: Nightreign's new major DLC update has finally been revealed. Titled The Forsaken Hollows, the DLC was announced during tonight's Sony State of Play livestream through a new trailer.

The Forsaken Hollows is set to release on 4th December. In the trailer, we see footage of some familiar characters, before revealing additional bosses on the way. That includes the iconic Artorias from Dark Souls - much requested by players - as well as the Dancing Lion from the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion, and a field boss version of the Gladius Nightlord.

Then there are the new playable characters. The first is the Scholar, an academic with impressive arcane levels who "gains incredible advantages through battlefield observation". The other is the Undertaker, an abbess with strength and faith skills who "sends enemies to the afterlife with ruthless efficiency". There's also a new Shifting Earth event called The Great Hollow, featuring exotic temples, the remains of an ancient people, and crystals exuding a cursed life-draining miasma - it looks similar to the Ancient Ruins of Rauh from Shadow of the Erdtree. And who are those holy knights with golden spears?

"In our war against the Night, every battle left a scar," reads a social media post on the Elden Ring account. "These wounds were given will. A foul life, born of cast-away souls. Steel your resolve, Nightfarers. This hunt must be seen to its end."

In our war against the Night, every battle left a scar.
These wounds were given will. A foul life, born of cast-away souls.
Steel your resolve, Nightfarers. This hunt must be seen to its end.#ELDENRING #NIGHTREIGN The Forsaken Hollows launches on December 4, 2025. pic.twitter.com/Eov9VMFFMC

‚Äî ELDEN RING (@ELDENRING) November 11, 2025

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

This reveal comes shortly after FromSoftware's parent company Kadokawa announced some new DLC for Nightreign was coming in March of next year, stealing the shine off this announcement a little bit. Nonetheless, it's great news for Nightreign, which proved exceptionally popular quickly passing 3.5m players within a week of its release.

If you've not played Elden Ring: Nightreign, why not read Eurogamer's review on the multiplayer Souls spin-off. In it, reviewer Ed Nightingale describes the game as such: "FromSoftware's multiplayer spin-off is an exhilarating rush and a celebration of the studio's prior achievements Souls veterans will devour."

Ed also predicted five things we'd love to see in Elden Ring: Nightreign DLC, how much did he get right?

Related topics

item.title: Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls is getting a second closed beta, with Ghost Rider and Spider-Man playable and this time, no interruptions
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls is getting another closed beta, this time with two new stages as well as Ghost Rider and Spider-Man playable. It'll be available starting the 5th of December, and will run interrupted for 72-hours.

To participate in this beta, eager players will have to sign up at the PlayStation beta website just like in the first closed beta test. This closed beta test will also feature the lobby system, which will allow beta testers to run around a large social space between matches.

In the new gameplay trailer released alongside the beta announced, we see both Ghost Rider and Spider-Man in-action, including a few glimpses at special moves and super attacks which are awfully tantalising. You can watch the announcement yourself below!

This appears to be a similar build to what was playable at Evo France, though that public build was limited only to the two new characters. The uninterrupted nature of this second beta test may seem an odd note, but that's because the first closed beta was broken up into separate testing periods.

This proved to be a major point of frustration for early players, and so it seems as though Arc System Works and Sony has listened to feedback and provided an opportunity for eager fighting game fans to really grind the game out next month.

If you fancy it, you can read Eurogamer's Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls preview here for an idea of what the game is like, and whether or not you should be excited. In it, the game is described as: "a visual carnival, a celebration of comic books, movement, and wall-to-wall action".

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/marvel-tokon-fighting-souls-is-getting-a-second-closed-beta-with-ghost-rider-and-spider-man-playable-and-this-time-no-interruptions

item.title: Gran Turismo 7 Power Pack adds 24-hour races alongside Spec III update in December
item.content:encoded:
Kaznori Yamauchi made a brief appearance during the State of Play Japan stream with a key announcement for Gran Turismo 7. With the GT7 Spec III coming out on 4th December, Polyphony Digital has also prepared a new Power Pack DLC to go alongside.

The Gran Turismo 7 Power Pack is a premium DLC that‚Äôs all about bringing fully fledged endurance racing to the popular sim racer for the first time.

This is a pretty big bundle, which will include in its bundle of content:

  • 50 new races across 20 themed categories, inspired by global automotive and motorsport traditions.
  • 24-hour endurance racing for players who crave the ultimate test of skill and stamina.
  • Full race weekends: Practice, qualify, and compete in the main event for a true racing simulation.
  • Gran Turismo Sophy 3.0 AI for intense, tail-to-nose battles that push your limits.
  • Includes 5,000,000 in-game Credits

This is really for the endurance racing lovers, with a wide array of races that will include country-inspired circuits and some of the most legendary endurance racing events ‚Äì the 24hrs of Le Mans no doubt included in that, but I‚Äôm hoping for a 24hr of Lemons event as well.. Gran Turismo Sophy 3.0 will aim to offer the most taxing AI racing challenge and competition possible through this.

While the Spec 3 update will be free for all players of GT7, the Power Pack will be paid DLC. Pricing has not yet been confirmed.

This is not the first time that full-on 24-hour races have featured as part of a Gran Turismo game. In GT5 you could race a full 24 hour race yourself, and put your B-Spec AI drivers into the mixer for some progression while you‚Äôre not actively playing the game, but endurance racing provides different challenges for the racing AI, pit stop strategies and more.

Of course, we‚Äôd have loved to have seen longer form racing included in GT7 from the off ‚Äì it‚Äôs often a bit of an afterthought, given the demands i puts on both players, game designers, and testers ‚Äì but Polyphony should be credited with consistently updating and expanding their games with free content, new tracks and more.

Spec 3 will be a big update for the 2022 racer, with the following new and improved features:

  • 2 new tracks (Yas Marina Circuit, Circuit Gilles-Villeneuve)
  • 8 new cars
  • ‚ÄòDunlop‚Äô tyres
  • Data Logger
  • Collector Level cap increased
  • Unlimited car invitations in Brand Central
  • Enhanced Weekly Challenges
  • New opening movie
  • New Menu Book ‚ÄòSeasonal Menu‚Äô
  • New events in ‚ÄòCircuit Experience‚Äô
  • New Curations in ‚ÄòScapes‚Äô
  • Improvements to online races

Source: PS Blog



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/11/gran-turismo-7-power-pack-adds-24-hour-races-alongside-spec-iii-update/
